H0.text: Which French prime minister was executed for treason in 1945. Philippe Pétain

H1.text: Which French prime minister was executed for treason in 1945. François Darlan

H2.text: Which French prime minister was executed for treason in 1945. Paul Reynaud

H3.text: Which French prime minister was executed for treason in 1945. Pierre laval

A4.text: Pétain was originally sentenced to death but his sentence was commuted to life in prison due to his age and World War I service.

A5.text: Pétain's government collaborated with the German military administration after the occupation of France in 1942.

A6.text: After the war, Laval was tried as a Nazi collaborator and executed for treason.

A7.text: Laval was found guilty of plotting against the security of the state and of collaboration with the enemy.
